channel.title: Decoy - Short Film
channel.description:
Well, here's a short film I made recently for my A-Level Media course. The acting and story aren't very strong at all, but it was a lot of fun to make! It was mostly an attempt at a professional-looking production. :wink:
[url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iN6Cp-j_Vxg&hd=1'][b][COLOR='Lime']Decoy[/SIZE][/b][/url]
It was all filmed and edited by me, including a lot of the sounds and music. :slight_smile:
Thanks,
[b]Harry[/b]

item.title: Decoy - Short Film
item.dc:creator: cjohnson
item.description:
Harry-UK:

Thanks guys! Nice crits mgmartin!

I used a Canon 550D (and a 5D Mark II on one or two shots). I also used a Hague DMC Steadicam for a lot of the shots, although I didn’t get a chance to perfect most of the pans / movements.

Yeah, the Canon 55 seems to me really gaining in popularity recently. I really need to get myself one.

When I saw the thread title my thoughts instantly shifted towards the short film Half-Life: Uplink because I had forgotten the name and Decoy sounds like Decay and Half-Life for the PlayStation had an addon called Decay so yea.

item.title: Decoy - Short Film
item.dc:creator: mgmartin
item.description:
Not bad at all. I´m not gonna say anything about the acting, which IMO isn´t that important. What´s more important is the production quality.

Good cinematography, although i would recommend that you use some more tripod shots. Wiggle from hand held camera isn´t that comfortable to look at after a while. My teacher use to say, “FOR GODS SAKE, USE TRIPOD YOU IDIOTS”.

Sound effects were a bit lame, at least for the fighting scenes. When the guy knock out that other guy with one punch it sounds like a weak slap in the face, so by all means, kick it up a notch.

I would also recommend that you cut out some of the walking which gets a bit boring after a while.

I´m not saying this is bad in any way, because this is good for a student production, but with some small changes it would go from good to great.

Best of luck with your next film and let us know how it turns out.

Read full topic
